page.title: 12LEISURE IN LONGSTANTON
page.content: A wide variety of groups cater for leisure needs. These include the Women's Institute, the Mother's Union, and the Wives' Club, which each meet monthly, and the Over-60s with their fortnightly meetings. The Sports and Social Club is very active, their Pavilion on the Recreation Ground opening every evening. There are groups for Badminton, Billiards, Tennis and Aerobics, and a keen interest in Bellringing which goes back more than a century. For small children there is the Play Group on three mornings a week, and the weekly Mothers and Toddlers group. Older children have Cubs, Brownies, Guides and the Girls' Venture Corps and the Air Training Corps. Perhaps it is not surprising that there are only the two pubs!
